intro: Polyochnella micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered polyochnella, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically produces tubular or campanulate flowers in shades of white or pale pink. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland or forest understory habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and somewhat obscure species within its native range.
